snippet.title: Very first Game and Watch Commercial [1980]
snippet.description:
Years before the Famicom (NES) was released, Nintendo -- a producer of Hanafuda cards and subsequently toys for kids,  had already experimented with electronic games by producing their own Pong clone and a simplistic light sensitive rifle target game called "Duck Hunt". 

In 1980, chief product designer Gunpei Yokoi [who would later invent the GameBoy] created a line of simple handheld devices that each featured a single game on an LCD screen that also had a clock and alarm. Naming the product just what it was - a Game and a Watch, the Game & Watch became a major success for Nintendo, and helped propel them towards further electronics development which lead to the Famicom, and history.

Want one of these? Then be prepared to shell out some serious cash - Game & Watch systems sell in the hundreds - sometimes even thousands depending on condition and completeness.
